claim: Read-Ahead Summary for High-Level Presentation on Q-SMEC Technology & Use Cases Q-SMEC Technology Overview Q-SMEC (Quantum Superconducting Magnetic Energy Containment) is a patented platform of sensor/storage material architectures leveraging quantum physics, AI-enhanced DOE modeling, and thin-film/3D-printed fabrication

Each instantiation is a unique multi-layer configuration of up to 22 quantum-optimized materials (10 disclosed; 12 confidential), enabling: Ultra-high bondon density (quantum bond network) THz-scale photonic/electronic behavior Order-of-magnitude improvements in signal-to-noise, sensitivity, energy storage Post-quantum secure and anti-tamper intrinsic design Core Target Properties: Lowest SWaP-C (Size/Weight/Power/Cost) Manufacturable on Stratasys-class additive systems CMMC/FedRAMP cybersecurity alignment ITAR compliant anti-tamper AI/ML co-optimized for SCADA/ICS environments Three Primary Use Cases in This Briefing Prussian Blue/White Alternative Energy Storage Targeting improvements in diffusion channels, conductivity, redox voltage, and strain minimization Competes with PBAs in grid-scale and defense battery storage THz Sensor/Emitter Parameters: NEP 0

01 g/cm^2) NRE Technical Development Model 6-Task staged engineering process totaling $770K, 7,700 Hrs over ~1 year: Task 1: Quantum modeling (DFT, CWF) ‚Äì $100K Task 2: DOE optimization (AI/HPC/Quantum) ‚Äì $110K Task 3: TRL 3-4 prototype systems engineering ‚Äì $190K Task 4: TRL 5-6 Lab integration ‚Äì $110K Task 5: TRL 7 demo/LRIP manufacturing ‚Äì $130K Task 6: TRL 8-9 validation and FFF packaging ‚Äì $130K Business Model & IP Strategy Licensing: Field-of-Use, Exclusive/Non-Exclusive Joint IP Rights with Instantiation Partners Structured Gate Funding Model ($25K prepay + 3 milestone-linked payments per task) Global NPV + License value analysis already completed for 200+ use cases Staffing & Capacity Plan Chief Scientist + Proprietary IT + PM = 120 hrs/week availability Capacity: 1 new instantiation project accepted every 2 months (H1 2026) Deep Analysis & Strategic Feedback Strengths: Extraordinary Technical Differentiation: Q-SMEC blends first-principles physics with manufacturable real-world configurations, standing out in a crowded materials innovation space
IP Defense Strategy: Trade secret + modular patent layers + field-of-use licensing give both commercial flexibility and investor defensibility
Threats: Competing Claims in Quantum Materials/IP: Race is heating up; delays in patent filings or ambiguity in trade secret boundaries could weaken IP position
Q-SMEC SENSOR PLATFORM: COMMERCIALIZATION & STRATEGIC EXECUTION DIRECTIVE Based solely on the CII NIKET proprietary Q-SMEC technology and use cases 1
Use of funds will map directly to NRE tasks and patent finalization timelines
